item.title: Cal Poly Pro Tip: Lost Items
item.description: If you lose a personal item somewhere on campus, you can go to https://afd.calpoly.edu/facilities/services/lost-and-found and file a lost item report. If they do not have your item, seek out the head of whichever building you lost the item in. For example, if you lost an item in our Statistics classroom (Room 123A of building 38), you go to the ethics department office located south of our classroom on the first floor.

item.title: Quote of the Week
item.description: "We need to stop teaching abstinence-only statistics, telling students they can only do it if they are in a committed relationship with a statistician. But all their friends are out there doing statistics and having a great time. We need to teach safe stats." ― Hadley Wickham Source: https://nhorton.people.amherst.edu/mererenovation/17_Wickham.PDF

item.title: Cal Poly Pro Tip: Waffles
item.description: At 805 Kitchen, to spice up your waffle, grab toppings from the yogurt bar (chocolate chips, coconut flakes, etc) and add it into your waffle batter before cooking your waffle!

item.title: Quote of the Week
item.description: “It is a capital mistake to theorize before one has data. Insensibly one begins to twist facts to suit theories, instead of theories to suit facts.” ― Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, Sherlock Holmes

item.title: Tweets of the Week
item.description:
A few times a year, I get asked to be a judge of student statistical projects in politics or sports. While the students are very bright, they spend WAY too much time using fancy statistical methods and not enough time framing the right questions and contextualizing their answers.

— Nate Silver (@NateSilver538) October 6, 2019
